channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pots holes getting deep and dangerous, 23rd February
item.description:
Hi The entrance road to BPP and and our houses are getting very deep, numerous and dangerous . We need them all repaired again please or ideally a complete road resurface with some quality materials please. There are many pot holes along the first stretch of road up to Y junction at least, the whole section needs re surveying gain pleasssssse . Thanks
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Beckenham Place Park, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Jumbo sized pothole in carrige way at Anerly Hill Bus Stop F, 22nd February
item.description:
There is a jumbo sized pothole in carrige way at Anerly Hill Bus Stop F only growing in size with the current weather, present for 1/2 months. Please see to photos attached where a A4 3 times folded size envalope is featured to show the scale of the pot hole, envalope sizes are 11 by 22 cm. This has previously been reported with repors ref. 8654572 & 8746904 over a month & more ago but has not been sorted. Posing a major risk to road uses; primerially cyclists and mopeds. Also casuing discomfort to rocky busses as they stop here for pick up & set down at the stop. Now is an ideal time to do this work with parial lane closure to the south, down hill, for gas works. Please could this be rectified.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: DANGEROUS OBSTRUCTION: Systematic Illegal Parking in Bus Lane â€“ 70 Caledonian Rd, 22nd February
item.description:
Location: Outside 70 Caledonian Rd, London N1 9DN (Merge point south of the junction) Details: This is a formal report of a recurring dangerous obstruction at the merge point outside the Al-Nehar Mosque (70 Caledonian Rd). Frequency: Every Sunday and frequently during Friday/weekday prayer times. Description of Hazard: > Multiple private vehicles are systematically abandoned in the bus lane. This occurs at a specific point where two lanes merge after the traffic lights. Because the road surface is in poor condition (deep pooling/potholes), cyclists are forced out of the safety of the bus lane and directly into the path of merging buses and taxis. Immediate Risk: > This is not a simple "parking" issue; it is a Category A Road Hazard. It creates a high probability of side-swipe collisions and "dooring" incidents for cyclists. The current lack of enforcement is creating a significant liability for the Council. Action Required: Urgent deployment of Civil Enforcement Officers (CEOs) during peak Sunday/prayer times. Assessment of CCTV enforcement for this specific bus lane stretch to prevent future occurrences. This situation has been flagged to the police, who advised that local regulations and Council cameras should be the primary enforcement tool. Please treat this as a safety priority.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Southern Street, Barnsbury, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
